instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476 Water Damaged, S4 Rails Missing
threads.message:
Hi,

I have a water damaged 820-3476. Initially it was turning on but after a minute or so would keep going into hibernate/standby mode. Now however it is not even turning on but does have a green light on the charger. Testing the board voltages for S5 rails are present but not for S4.

PM_SLP_S4_L is 0.195 volts
ALL_SYS_PWRGD is 0 Volts

I am a bit unsure where to go from here.

Thanks

threads.title: 820-3476 Water Damaged, S4 Rails Missing
threads.message: It should get a green light and then orange without battery connected. Is SMC_LID high? Where was the liquid damage?

threads.title: 820-3476 Water Damaged, S4 Rails Missing
threads.message: Yeah I get a green light then it goes orange. Most of the water damage was around the connector for the keyboard backlight and the Mic connector. Everywhere else looking under a microscope doesn't seem too bad. I get 3.3 Volts at SMC_LID and in diode mode it measures 0.438.

threads.title: 820-3476 Water Damaged, S4 Rails Missing
threads.message: Could be anything. Inspect for corrosion around the usual suspects, U1900/U1950, U6100 and traces/termination resistors, crap under SMC. PPVRTC present?

threads.title: 820-3476 Water Damaged, S4 Rails Missing
threads.message: I have checked all these and there is no evidence of water damage or corrosion. PPVRTC is 3.3 volts. I am obviously missing something but I can't figure it out.

threads.title: 820-3476 Water Damaged, S4 Rails Missing
threads.message: Check all rails for shorts? Is the keyboard backlight connector shorting out?
